titles.title: A bill to amend section 102 of the Social Security Amendments of 1983 to include individuals between the ages of forty-six and fifty-five within the special provisions (now applicable only to individuals age fifty-five or over) which liberalize the insured status requirements for certain employees of nonprofit organizations whose services were mandatorily covered by such amendments.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Amends the Social Security Amendments of 1983 to provide that individuals aged 46 and over who are employees of nonprofit organizations whose employees are covered under the Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance program and who acquire the appropriate number of quarters of coverage after January 1, 1984, shall be considered fully insured individuals for purposes of title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act. (Under current law, those employees aged 55 or over are granted such insured status.)
